meanings.definition: A plant disease, especially one caused by fungi.
meanings.sent1: The farmer's biggest worry was the blights affecting his crops.
meanings.sent2: The blights on the leaves indicated a fungal infection.
meanings.sent3: The blights on the plants seemed to be having a party of their own.
meanings.sent4: The blights spread through the garden like a dark shadow.
meanings.sent5: The blights turned the once vibrant garden into a scene of decay.

meanings.sent1: The blights of war left a lasting impact on the country.
meanings.sent2: The blights of negativity can hinder progress.
meanings.sent3: The blights of laziness crept into his daily routine.
meanings.sent4: The blights of doubt clouded her judgment.
meanings.sent5: The blights of jealousy can poison relationships.

meanings.sent1: Negativity can blights one's outlook on life.
meanings.sent2: The storm blights the peaceful atmosphere of the town.
meanings.sent3: His constant complaining blights the mood of the group.
meanings.sent4: The invasive species blights the native plants.
meanings.sent5: The corrupt practices blights the reputation of the company.
